But what about those L_conflicts that do not M_take L_place within such a L_constituted L_social M_system , such as L_conflictual L_bourgeois L_societies which can not be L_said to be L_unified , except , as L_Sartre M_suggests L_dismissively , by M_appeal to a M_lost M_paradise before the L_class M_struggle ?

Such L_societies M_make the L_conflicts of L_history L_irreducible to L_Sartre 's L_logic unless , like the L_boxing L_match , they can be M_shown to M_take M_part in a M_larger L_totalizable L_category .

L_However , when he L_poses the L_question of whether his L_method could M_work as L_well for the L_class M_struggle as for the L_boxing L_match , L_Sartre M_admits that he M_finds it L_impossible to L_answer and M_returns L_instead to the L_much L_easier L_case of L_sub-groups .
Once again he M_backtracks and M_assumes a M_larger L_unity in which L_conflict M_takes L_place .

The L_major L_question L_thus L_always L_remains L_unanswered in the L_Critique : every L_time that L_Sartre M_announces that he is about to M_proceed with the L_fundamental L_problem of how L_History can be a L_totalization without a L_totalizer , he M_turns M_back to a L_previous , more L_easily L_intelligible M_stage on the M_way .

His L_difficulty is M_accompanied by a no L_doubt M_symptomatic L_increasing L_distrust of L_universals so that , in L_championing L_specificities against them , he L_seems to L_give up the L_attempt to L_validate the L_universals — L_History as L_Totalization — that L_originally M_formed the M_object of his L_project .

At this M_point a further L_contradiction in L_Sartre 's M_whole L_enterprise L_begins to M_open up : for L_someone so M_deeply L_distrustful of L_universals it L_seems L_curious that he has L_involved himself so L_emphatically with the L_notions of L_totality , L_History , and the L_dialectic .

As L_Sartre L_insists more and more upon the M_virtues of L_specificity ( II , 200 — 05 ) , such is his L_distaste for L_Marxist or any other L_universalizing L_categories that he L_refuses L_even to L_countenance them , L_attempting to M_replace L_concepts with L_specificities , L_universals with L_singulars .

His L_scepticism M_goes to the M_extent of L_even L_denying the L_existence of ‘ L_society ’ or ‘ the L_nation ’ as such ( II , 24 , 61 ) — the very L_totalities which his own L_general L_argument for L_totalization L_requires .
Here L_certain L_similarities with L_later ‘ L_post-Marxist ’ L_theorists such as L_Foucault or L_Lyotard , L_begin to L_become L_apparent .
But if L_Sartre L_anticipates such L_later L_thinkers we should not M_assume too M_quickly that they have L_simply M_taken his L_insights further .

For L_Sartre 's L_singular L_universal could L_never be L_expected to L_solve the M_formal L_theoretical L_problem of how L_individual L_existential L_existence can be L_related to L_History L_insofar as it L_simply L_renames , in one L_oxymoronic L_category , the L_original L_antithetical L_terms .
Without an L_adequate L_theory of their M_articulation , they L_simply L_begin to M_separate again .
The L_Philosopher 's L_Child
L_Judith L_Hughes
SOME OF OUR L_CHILDREN ARE MISSING
L_Children have M_served L_philosophy very L_well .
That is the L_first M_thing which L_anyone M_surveying the L_literature would L_notice .

Along with a L_selection from a L_list L_including L_women , L_animals , L_madmen , L_foreigners , L_slaves , L_patients and L_imbeciles , L_children have M_served in that M_great L_class of beings , the ‘ L_not-men ’ , in M_contrast with which L_male L_philosophers have M_defined and M_valued themselves .

Unlike the L_others who M_appear and M_disappear as M_fashion and M_progress M_dictate , L_children M_occupy a L_permanent M_place in the L_list L_partly because of their L_continuing M_presence as a L_potential M_sub-class , L_partly because they have L_never L_protested and L_mainly because it is L_assumed that in L_favourable L_circumstances they will L_become L_men and L_therefore L_require L_attention .
They have L_received it in the M_shape of L_detailed L_educational L_theory L_carefully L_worked out to M_see them through the L_maturation L_process from L_infancy to L_adulthood .
L_Generations of L_philosophers have L_documented this L_process .

L_Perhaps the L_best L_known L_version is L_Shakespeare 's seven L_ages of L_man which is a L_poetic L_statement of what had L_already been L_received L_wisdom for L_centuries and was to L_remain so for L_centuries to M_come .
L_Education was to M_guide the L_infant through the L_transition to L_manhood L_including such M_stages as L_childhood , L_boyhood and L_youth .
That is the L_second M_thing to L_notice ; the L_philosopher 's L_children are L_boys .

The L_fact that at L_least L_half of the L_world 's L_children would not L_actually M_go through this L_process beyond the L_first two M_stages is L_conveniently L_forgotten or L_ignored and , no L_doubt , the L_reasons for this were L_largely L_social .
But the L_neglect of L_girl L_children through the L_centuries of L_theorising is more than a L_social L_injustice , though L_many might L_think this L_real and L_bad L_enough .
L_Education has an M_end .

Although it is L_fashionable to L_talk about its M_value ‘ for its own L_sake ’ , what M_prompts the L_theorising is the M_strong and L_well-founded L_belief that the L_experiences of L_childhood L_affect the L_kind of L_adult which the L_child M_turns out to be .

Where the M_end is L_person- L_rather than M_role-oriented — that is , where the M_end is the L_development of the L_human L_mind and L_spirit L_rather than the M_production of , L_say , L_information L_technologists — then L_education is M_valued in L_relation to some M_conception of L_worthwhile L_human L_existence which it is L_meant to M_serve .

Such an L_ideal does not M_stand M_isolated from the L_practices which M_strive towards it but M_interacts with those L_practices , M_helps to M_construct them , and is in M_turn M_constructed by them .
The M_great L_philosophers have L_always M_produced such a L_person-oriented M_account at L_least for those whose L_education was L_thought to L_matter .
L_Education has been M_directed at the M_production of the L_rational , the M_free , the L_independent of L_mind , the L_dignified , in L_short , the M_autonomous L_human being .

L_Yet because the L_philosopher 's L_adult has L_traditionally been L_male , his L_children L_boy L_children , and his L_educational L_programmes M_designed to L_facilitate the L_transition between them , the L_ideal of the L_fully L_human L_person has been L_masculinised to the M_point where L_otherwise L_thoughtful and L_sometimes L_good and L_wise L_men have L_unashamedly M_admitted that this M_defining L_ideal is not L_applicable to half the L_species .

L_Rationality L_turns into M_narrow L_intellectualism , M_freedom into L_licence , L_independence into L_isolationism , L_dignity into L_selfish L_pride ; the M_autonomous L_human being M_turns out to be no more than a L_social M_atom after all .

The L_degeneration M_occurs , not because L_men are M_congenitally or L_even L_incorrigibly M_narrow , L_libertine , M_isolated or L_selfish , but because in M_defining themselves as M_autonomous beings in L_opposition to other L_human beings they have had to L_seek what M_separates them as a M_group from L_others .
It is a M_curiously L_paradoxical M_foundation uponupon which to M_build a L_theory of M_autonomy .
L_Moral M_autonomy is M_concerned with L_individuals not with M_groups ; a M_conception of M_autonomy which L_depends upon M_group L_membership M_displays its own L_contradiction .
This L_paper is L_partly about the L_rejection of L_certain M_accounts of M_autonomy though not with the L_rejection of the L_ideal of M_autonomy itself .
It is L_also about L_children .
L_WOMEN L_PHILOSOPHERS AND L_GIRL L_CHILDREN
Why should L_women in L_general and L_women L_philosophers in L_particular be L_specially L_interested in the M_nature and L_status of L_children ?
There are , of L_course , the L_familiar and L_obvious L_reasons M_connected with L_women 's L_traditional M_role in L_child-rearing but there are L_less L_obvious L_reasons too .
When L_philosophers M_dismiss L_women as ‘ L_not-men ’ they L_frequently do more than L_simply L_lump them M_together with L_children or L_lunatics .
L_Explicitly or L_implicitly the L_suggestion is that L_women are L_children or L_lunatics or whichever other M_company they M_keep .
It would be L_well to L_know just what this M_entails .
L_Schopenhauer M_said that L_women L_remain L_big L_children all their L_lives ; it would be L_interesting to L_know what he L_thought L_children were L_like .

A L_common L_result of this is that when the L_philosophers L_deny M_autonomy to L_women , they do so for the same L_sorts of L_reason that they L_deny it to L_children and L_cite L_lack of L_rationality , L_capriciousness and L_vulnerability among their L_characteristics .
We can do more than to L_reject such L_descriptions of ourselves ; we can L_ask further L_questions : are L_children like this ? is this why L_children are not M_autonomous ?
Again , L_women L_well L_know what it is like to be L_treated as L_children and they M_find it M_offensive .
It would L_therefore be L_reasonable to M_consider whether L_children M_find it M_offensive to be L_treated like L_children .
Is being L_treated as a L_child an L_intrinsically L_humiliating and L_self-denying L_experience ?
What is it to be L_treated as a L_child ?
L_Women L_philosophers are in a L_special M_position to M_consider such L_questions for in the M_image of the L_philosopher 's L_child they M_see themselves .

It is no M_accident that the M_liberation of L_women , such as it is , should M_form M_part of a M_wider M_movement of M_liberation in L_general ; M_liberation for one M_part of the ‘ L_not-men ’ is M_bound to have a L_knock-on L_effect when your M_fellow M_groups are L_sometimes L_quite L_literally L_identified with you .

The L_assumption that all M_groups in the ‘ L_not-men ’ L_class are L_identical with each other is so M_firmly L_rooted that , as we shall M_see in the L_fourth M_section , it is L_readily L_assumed L_even by L_modern L_libertarian L_thinkers that M_showing that , for L_example , some M_ground for M_distinguishing between L_men and L_women is M_false or L_irrelevant , M_immediately M_commits us to the M_view that the same M_ground is L_irrelevant in M_distinguishing L_men from L_children .
‘ That 's what they L_used to M_say about L_women ’ is not a L_proof that M_saying it about a L_child is M_false .
But it should M_make us very L_suspicious .

That when L_women are M_given the L_vote it M_follows that L_children should be M_given it too is no L_argument at all , but a L_version of it M_occurs in L_modern L_debates over the L_justice or L_injustice of L_Mill 's L_famous L_disclaimer in his L_essay On L_Liberty .
Having L_denied that we may L_ever L_legitimately L_interfere with the M_liberty of another except on the M_grounds of L_self-protection , L_Mill ( 1910 ) M_asserts :
this L_principle is L_meant to M_apply only to L_human beings in the L_maturity of their L_faculties .
We are not M_speaking of L_children or of L_young L_persons below the L_age which the L_law may M_fix as that of L_manhood or L_womanhood .
Those who are L_still in a L_state to L_require being M_taken L_care of by L_others must be L_protected against their own L_actions as L_well as against L_external M_injury .

This M_view , as we shall M_see , has been M_attacked on the M_grounds that it M_rests on the M_false L_assumption that the L_distinction between L_adults and L_children is L_identical with the L_distinction between L_rational and L_non-rational beings .
The M_attacks are M_based on L_empirical M_observation ; most L_women and L_older L_children are L_actually L_quite as L_rational as most L_men while some L_men are L_actually L_less L_rational .
If we L_agree that in that L_case L_women should be M_embraced by the M_liberty L_principle then so should L_children .
I shall L_suggest that this does not M_follow because L_rationality is not in L_fact the M_grounds for the L_distinction in the L_first M_place .

L_Partly to L_redress the M_balance and L_partly because M_talking about ‘ L_children ’ M_covers such a M_wide M_range of L_potential M_images , I shall L_try to M_keep before my L_mind an L_ordinary 10-year-old of our L_society .
She is the L_child of this L_paper unless I M_indicate L_otherwise .
Throughout we should L_ask ourselves , does this ( whatever is being M_said ) M_apply to her ?
L_First of all , L_let us L_remind ourselves of the L_traditional M_picture of L_children M_drawn for us by some M_great L_philosophers of the L_past .

One M_thing they are all L_quite L_sure about is that L_children are not like L_adults ; in L_particular they L_agree that L_children L_lack some M_capacity for L_rational L_thought which L_adults have .
NOW WE ARE 6 — OR 10 — OR 18 … .
the L_slave has L_absolutely no L_deliberative L_faculty ; the L_woman has but its M_authority is L_imperfect ; so has the L_child , but in this L_case it is M_immature .
( L_Aristotle , 1959,1260A )

L_Children … are not M_endued with L_Reason at all , till they have L_attained the L_use of L_speech but are M_called L_Reasonable L_Creatures for the L_possibility L_apparent of having the L_use of L_Reason in L_time to M_come .
( L_Hobbes , 1914 , p. 21 )
L_Children … L_love to be L_treated as L_Rational L_Creatures L_sooner than is L_imagined … by which …

I L_mean , that you should M_make them L_sensible by the Mildness of your M_carriage , and the L_composure L_even in your L_correction of them , that what you do is L_reasonable in you and L_useful and L_necessary for them .
In M_training for L_youth , the L_child must be M_given L_reasons ; in the M_training of the L_infant for L_childhood this can not be done .
L_Young L_children ought L_merely to have M_things M_shown to them as they are , or they L_get L_puzzled and L_ask L_question after L_question .
But as we M_approach the L_age of L_youth L_reason M_appears .
At what L_age ought the L_education for L_youth to M_begin ?
M_Roughly at the L_age of ten L_years , when by M_nature the L_child M_enters the M_stage of L_youth and L_begins to M_reflect …
The L_youth … is L_capable of having L_principles ; his L_religious and L_moral L_ideas can be M_cultivated , and he is L_able to L_attend to his own M_refinement .

If a L_society M_lets any L_considerable L_number of its M_members L_grow up L_mere L_children , L_incapable of being L_acted on by L_rational M_consideration of M_distant L_motives , L_society has itself to M_blame for the L_consequences .
What are the L_philosophers ' L_children like ?

They have an ‘ M_immature ’ L_deliberative L_faculty ( L_Aristotle ) , are not ‘ M_endued with L_Reason ’ ( L_Hobbes ) , until M_roughly the L_age of 10 ( L_Kant ) and are ‘ L_incapable of being M_acted upon by L_rational L_consideration of M_distant L_motives ’ ( L_Mill ) .
But they are not L_completely M_lost M_causes .

The M_immature L_deliberative L_faculty will M_mature ; L_children have the ‘ L_possibility L_apparent ’ of L_turning into L_rational beings ( L_Hobbes ) ; they L_love to be L_reated as though they were L_rational though they are not so L_yet ( L_Locke ) ; you can M_give the L_prerational L_child L_reasons for L_acting in L_certain M_ways and he will L_turn into the L_youth who is L_capable of having L_principles ( L_Kant ) .
Until the L_time when these M_things L_happen then L_Mill 's L_disclaimer M_comes into L_operation .
L_Children must be M_taken L_care of by L_others and L_protected from L_external M_injury and against their own L_actions .

The L_traditional M_view is M_encapsulated in the L_claim that L_children are not M_autonomous ; that is , on a L_standard L_interpretation , they L_lack the M_capacity to L_act L_rationally in M_pursuit of their own L_self-chosen M_goals .
It is then a L_matter of L_preference whether you M_say that they can not L_choose the M_goals or that they can not M_form L_strategies to L_achieve them or both .
In either L_case , the L_political L_implication is that L_denying L_rights to L_children is L_entirely M_justified , and there the L_matter M_rests .

In all this , there are L_perhaps a L_couple of M_things which M_look L_plausible when we L_compare the L_philosopher 's L_child with our L_mental M_picture ; L_Aristotle 's M_observation that L_children are M_immature and L_Mill 's L_suggestion that they might L_need L_protection .
Beyond that , the L_similarities L_seem M_remote .

There is L_obviously L_something L_wrong with a L_portrayal of L_children as L_totally L_lacking in L_reason until they L_leap out of L_bed on their L_tenth L_birthday L_announcing that they are now L_able to L_act on L_principle .

L_Apart from being L_false , such an M_account M_leaves no M_room in our L_thinking about L_children for M_things like L_teaching and L_learning , or L_development in L_understanding and L_character and all those other L_concepts which M_refer to L_processes and not to L_states .

The M_tension between these L_theoretical M_views of L_children as L_non-rational , M_non-autonomous beings and the L_practical L_knowledge of L_real L_children is L_evident in those L_quotations from L_Hobbes and L_Locke and L_Kant and L_Mill .
L_Children , L_according to L_Hobbes , have the ‘ L_possibility L_apparent ’ of L_becoming L_reasonable .
In what does the L_possibility L_consist ?

L_Hobbes is not L_using an L_inductive L_argument here ; the ‘ L_possibility L_apparent ’ is not an L_inductive L_argument from M_observations about M_past L_children but is L_meant to M_refer to some L_discernible M_feature of M_present L_ones .
But what ?
L_Hobbes does not M_tell us , but whatever it is it had L_better be L_something which a L_monkey does not have .
It is not L_language since L_Hobbes is here M_talking about the L_prelinguistic L_child .
L_Perhaps it L_consists in the L_ability to M_respond L_intelligently to the L_language of L_others .

But then , either L_Hobbes has L_failed to M_distinguish the L_child from at L_least the M_higher and L_domesticated L_animals or the M_force of ‘ L_intelligently ’ must be L_explained in such a M_way as to M_exclude L_animals .
In any L_case , if such a L_qualification is M_called for it is M_hard to M_see how a L_creature with no L_rationality at all could M_possess it .
L_Locke 's L_remarks are just as L_puzzling .
L_Children are L_definitely not L_rational but L_love to be L_treated as if they were .
How is this L_possible ?
L_Apparently they L_like having M_things L_explained to them without L_understanding either the L_explanation or L_even what an L_explanation is .
L_Perhaps he just L_means that they L_like the L_sound of my L_voice ?
L_Well , L_maybe they do , but L_making any M_old L_noises is L_clearly not L_sufficient to M_enter the L_rationality M_stakes ; I must at L_least M_say L_something .
Is it just that I L_talk to them that they L_love ?
L_Maybe , but I can L_also , if I L_like , L_talk to my L_car , but L_yelling at it in the L_approved L_Basil L_Fawlty L_manner is L_hardly L_treating it as L_rational .

L_Lockean L_children have the M_added L_amazing L_ability to M_recognise L_reason in you without M_possessing any themselves , while L_Kantian L_kids , two M_stages M_back from L_rationality , have the L_disconcerting M_habit of L_getting L_puzzled and L_asking L_questions .
L_Mill 's L_minors are a L_little more L_complicated .
M_Part of the L_time he M_sees them in the L_familiar M_way as L_creatures who L_lack L_rationality to at L_least some M_degree .
But in the L_disclaimer his L_children L_need above all to be L_protected from the L_ghastly L_consequences of their own L_actions .

Their L_problem L_seems to be not one of the L_inability to M_choose M_goals or to M_form L_strategies for L_achieving them , but an M_incorrigible L_propensity to M_choose the L_wrong L_ones and an L_awesome L_efficiency in L_achieving them unless L_adults L_intervene .
All in all , it is a L_pretty L_unconvincing M_picture .

If you M_say that L_children are L_completely L_non-rational then you have to L_account for the L_fact that they L_become L_rational , and to do that it L_appears from these L_examples that you have to L_assume that they L_already are .
If , on the other M_hand , you M_allow L_rationality to L_children , then you can not L_use their L_lack of it as a L_criterion to M_distinguish them from L_adults .
L_Hobbes L_et L_al .
are not L_aware of the L_unreality of their L_original M_pictures which is why , L_often in the same L_sentence , they M_produce these L_contradictions .
The one M_thing they do not do is to L_re-examine the M_original for the L_tell-tale M_signs of M_forgery .
L_ILLEGITIMATE L_INFERENCES

The M_recognition that L_children can not L_simply be M_written off in the L_rationality M_stakes and can not L_therefore be L_denied M_autonomy on this M_account has M_led some L_writers to L_conclude that they can not , L_therefore , be L_denied it on any M_account .
We should M_notice that this M_view is not just a M_flight of L_fancy from the L_loony L_left , the L_pederast L_lobby or L_children themselves .
It is L_also to be M_found in M_stronger or M_weaker M_versions of more L_cautious L_academic L_thought .
In L_Escape from L_Childhood ( 1974 ) , L_John L_Holt M_notes that L_children are , in L_fact , L_capable of a L_great L_deal more than L_modern L_society M_allows them to be .
He M_sees L_childhood as a L_fairly L_modern M_invention M_designed to M_fit L_adult L_rather than L_children 's L_needs , and an L_oppressive M_invention at that .

He L_suggests that L_children should be M_given a L_comprehensive M_range of L_civil and L_legal L_rights L_including the L_right to L_vote , to L_manage their own L_financial L_affairs , to M_direct and L_manage their own L_education and to M_control their own L_sex L_lives and

to M_make and M_enter into , on a L_basis of L_mutual L_consent , L_quasifamilial L_relationships outside L_one 's M_immediate L_family — i.e. the L_right to L_seek and L_choose L_guardians other than one 's own L_parents and to be L_legally L_dependent on them .
This is L_also the M_view L_put L_forward by L_John L_Harris , though in L_less L_specific L_terms .
Like L_Holt , L_Harris L_believes that the L_so-called L_incompetence of L_children is an L_adult M_invention L_imposed on L_children for L_adults ' L_convenience .
He M_makes a M_firm L_proposal that the L_age of L_majority should be L_gradually M_reduced to 10 L_years , and L_remarks :

We must L_remember that to L_deny L_someone M_control of their own L_lives is to L_offer them a most L_profound L_insult , not to L_mention the which the L_frustration of their L_wishes and the M_setting at M_naught of their own L_plans for themselves will M_add .
L_Perhaps we should M_conduct L_annual L_examinations from an L_early L_age to be L_sure that we do as L_little of this L_sort of M_damage as L_possible ?
( L_Harris , 1982 , p. 49 )

Now L_Holt and L_Harris both have L_many M_wise , M_enlightened and M_humane M_observations to M_make about some of the L_injustices which we L_inflict upon L_children , but as these L_remarks M_show , M_putting them L_right without L_inflicting L_equally L_grave L_injustice is no L_easy L_matter .

Both of them L_appear to M_suffer from a M_form of L_mental M_myopia in L_imagining the L_consequences of such L_proposals , and I am not here M_referring only to L_Mill-type L_consequences of L_harm L_brought about by L_unwise L_decisions .
What , we may L_ask L_Holt , L_happens to the L_child who , L_dissatisfied at L_home , L_seeks in L_vain for L_guardians who would M_suit him ?
What if no L_one L_wants him ?
Our L_papers are L_currently M_full of ‘ M_hard-to-place ’ L_children in L_local L_authority L_care L_advertising for L_foster or L_adoptive L_parents .

In such a M_situation the L_skilled L_care of L_social L_workers is L_crucial to L_ensuring that an L_unwanted M_by-product of L_success for some L_children is not the L_total M_destruction of L_self-esteem for L_others .
What , we may L_ask L_Harris , L_happens to the L_child who L_repeatedly L_fails his L_annual L_examination ?
To L_impose such a L_test on L_children would be a L_particularly L_invidious M_way of L_discriminating against them , unless L_Harris has in L_mind that we should all L_undergo such L_examination .
He might then be M_open to M_bitter L_objections from L_many L_adults .

These two L_suggestions , M_far from being L_enlightened M_liberation of all L_children , are L_actually L_oppression of a M_deeply M_damaging L_kind to at L_least some , and L_Harris 's L_suggestion M_contains a M_capacity L_criterion in M_disguise .
In any L_case , it would be L_dishonest to L_pretend that L_Mill-type L_consequences are not L_relevant here .
L_Suppose L_Holt 's 6-year-old does L_opt out of L_school ?
What L_happens to her then ?
What L_happens if her L_father is L_unwilling or L_unable to L_stay at L_home with her ?
Is it any L_better to L_oblige her to L_go L_abseiling or L_butterfly-catching L_instead ?
L_However L_much she may L_enjoy such L_pursuits , there will be L_times when she would L_actually L_rather L_wander the L_streets L_unaccompanied .
L_Given that L_Holt is L_presumably not L_volunteering himself to M_take L_care of her , who will ?

His M_view that L_letting L_children L_run in and out of L_busy L_airports L_smartly L_avoiding the L_traffic is L_perfectly L_reasonable L_depends upon a M_conception of a L_child which is M_far M_narrower than L_even the L_sex L_divide .
L_Holt 's L_child is L_actually the M_Artful M_Dodger ; L_mercifully , not all L_children are .
There are other L_difficulties too .
It is not M_clear whether or not L_Harris L_thinks that L_children of 10 should be L_obliged to L_take on M_full L_political L_status whether or not they L_want to , but L_Holt L_clearly does not .

He L_proposes that ‘ the L_rights , L_privileges , L_duties , L_responsibilities of L_adult L_citizens be M_made L_available to any L_young L_person , of whatever L_age , who L_wants to M_make L_use of them ’ ( L_Holt , 1974 , p. 15 ) .
If L_Holt L_thinks that this L_proposal would M_remove an L_arbitrary M_boundary M_line between L_adults and L_children , then he is L_mistaken .
The M_point about an L_adult L_citizen is that he has these L_rights , L_privileges , L_duties and L_responsibilities whether or not he L_wants them .
He may not M_exercise his L_rights or he may L_shirk his L_duties , but he can not L_forgo them .
They are not just L_available to him , they are his .
That is what being a L_citizen M_involves .
L_Rights and L_privileges do not L_pose any L_particular L_problems in the L_case of L_children .
L_Holt can and does L_believe that L_children should have them as L_adults do , and then M_leaves it up to the L_child to L_decide whether or not to M_exercise them .
But the same can not be M_said for L_duties and L_responsibilities .
L_Failure to M_exercise one 's L_rights may be L_morally L_neutral ; L_failure to L_carry out one 's L_duties is not .

It would be L_perfectly L_possible to M_give the L_rights to L_children without L_imposing the L_duties on them , the L_one does not M_entail the other , but we would then L_still be M_distinguishing between L_adults and L_children as L_citizens .
L_Children L_still would not have M_full L_political L_status .
L_Duties and L_responsibilities are not L_merely L_available to a L_citizen ; they are an M_integral M_part of being a L_citizen .

L_Holt does not L_want L_children to be L_obliged to L_take on any of these L_responsibilities and he M_manages to M_make his M_point by M_concentrating L_solely on the L_rights so that he can L_remark :
I do not M_say , L_either , that these L_rights and L_duties should be M_tied into one M_package , that if a L_young L_person L_wants to L_assume any of them , he must L_assume them all .
He should be L_able to M_pick and L_choose .

If he can ‘ M_pick and L_choose ’ , I L_suggest , he is not a L_citizen , he does not have M_full L_political L_status and he is L_quite M_distinguishable on these M_grounds L_alone from the L_adults around him who do not have this L_option .
L_Holt and L_Harris both , in the M_end , M_face the same L_problem .

They M_attack the L_status L_quo by M_pointing out that the L_reasons M_given for L_denying L_rights to L_children are L_bad L_reasons , and then L_explicitly or L_implicitly L_deny them L_duties for no L_reason at all .

Whatever L_else such a L_strategy may M_achieve , it L_certainly does not M_manage to M_produce a M_situation in which L_children are L_politically M_indistinguishable from L_adults and it M_rests on M_premises which , unless they can be M_defended , M_gain L_nothing for any M_defence to the M_charge of L_arbitrariness .
WHEN IN L_DOUBT , M_GO M_BACK TO L_ARISTOTLE

The L_trouble with all the M_views which we have M_looked at is that they M_tie the L_notion of M_autonomy M_firmly and L_solely to that of L_knowledge M_interpreted in either a M_broad or M_narrow M_sense .
That it is M_firmly M_tied must be L_correct ; the L_inhabitants of M_Brave M_New M_World are not M_autonomous L_precisely because they are L_denied M_access to L_relevant L_information .
L_Relevant L_knowledge is a L_precondition of M_autonomy but it is not M_synonymous with it .

L_Aristotle M_said L_something very L_interesting in that M_extract from the L_Politics which I L_quoted L_earlier ; he M_said that L_women have a L_deliberative L_faculty but that it L_lacks M_full M_authority .
What did he L_mean ?
TWENTY-EIGHT
L_Nairobi .
We L_start with a L_young L_man , L_Thomas L_Fairfax , in L_military L_khaki and L_flying L_jacket , L_climbing into his L_old L_biplane and L_taxiing down a L_runway .
He L_adjusts the L_flaps , L_zips up his L_jacket , L_pulls down his L_goggles .
The L_runway is L_simply a L_strip of L_grass , L_cleared of L_rocks .
The L_plane M_lurches into L_motion .
It L_bounces L_alarmingly as it M_gathers L_speed .
A few L_Africans , L_clutching L_sticks and L_wearing L_skins , L_watch the L_plane as it M_turns , M_pauses , and then L_accelerates , M_leaving a M_cloud of L_dust .
The L_plane M_climbs M_reluctantly , one L_set of M_wings M_dipping M_drunkenly .
L_Soon it is L_passing over the L_spectacular L_Rift L_Valley .
There is no M_sign of L_civilization , but L_herds of L_zebra and L_wildebeest and M_clumps of L_elephants M_marble the L_valley M_floor .
L_Ol L_Doinyo L_Lengai .
A L_group of L_Masai is L_clearing L_stones from a M_stretch of L_grassland , in the L_shadow of the L_Mountain of L_God .
A L_large L_white L_cross has been L_painted L_roughly on the L_ground .
L_Claudia L_Cohn-Casson is L_sitting under an L_enormous L_African L_fig L_tree near by , at a L_camp L_table L_spread with a L_Somali L_cloth .
She has in L_front of her a L_typewriter , her L_recorder and her L_notes .
A L_servant is L_preparing L_lunch on a L_fire .
L_Claudia L_hears L_something .
She L_looks up into the L_sky in the L_direction of L_Ol L_Doinyo L_Lengai .
We M_catch L_sight of a L_small L_plane L_circling the L_mountain .
It M_dips its M_wings in M_acknowledgement of the L_landing L_strip , and L_circles , M_preparing to L_land .
L_Claudia L_stands up .
She L_checks her L_appearance in a L_mirror L_hanging on a L_tree .
With her L_lower L_lip she L_tucks the L_upper L_lip into her L_mouth for a L_moment .
She is L_wearing a L_long L_fitted L_skirt of L_khaki .
She L_adjusts her L_hat , a L_round L_bush L_hat , and L_walks towards the L_makeshift L_landing L_strip .
The L_plane is L_taxiing , L_pursued by a L_group of L_running L_Masai L_warriors , L_glorious in their L_red and L_purple L_robes , L_ochred L_hair , L_lion L_head-dresses and so on .
L_Claudia L_walks over towards the L_plane .
She L_holds her L_hat on her L_head with one L_hand .
The L_plane is L_still now , L_surrounded by the L_warriors .
L_Fairfax is L_securing its L_wheels with L_rocks .
He L_looks up to L_see her L_approaching .
Behind her is L_Ol L_Doinyo L_Lengai .
Its L_strange L_shape has L_become M_familiar to us .
His L_face is L_still L_dirty from the L_dust and L_oil , except that around his L_eyes is a L_white L_patch where the L_goggles were .
The L_Masai L_begin to L_sing .
It is a L_strange , L_other-worldly L_noise .
L_Claudia and L_Fairfax L_approach each other .
